rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.NHOID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears.
datasetVariables.label: Non-host Organism ID
datasetVariables.name: NHOID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: MSSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. In SDTMIG v3.2 this was an Expected variable. In this version, the core designation has been changed to Permissible.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: MSGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSREFID

datasetVariables.description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., an identifier for the culture/isolate being tested for susceptibility).
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: MSREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: MSSPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSLNKID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, it may be used to link genetic findings (in the PF domain) about a microbe to the original culture of that microbe (in MB), or to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed.
datasetVariables.label: Link ID
datasetVariables.name: MSLNKID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C128688

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short character value for MSTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MIC" for Minimum Inhibitory Concentration; "MICROSUS" for Microbial Susceptibility.
datasetVariables.label: Short Name of Assessment
datasetVariables.name: MSTESTCD

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSTRESC

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MSORRES in a standard format or in standard units. MSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MSSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in MSORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
datasetVariables.name: MSSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MSSTRESC. MSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MSSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized units used for MSSTRESC and MSSTRESN. Example: "mol/L".
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MSSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSNRIND

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by MSORNRLO and MSORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N", "HIGH", "LOW", "NORMAL". "ABNORMAL".
datasetVariables.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
datasetVariables.name: MSNRIND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85495

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSRESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. In SDTMIG v3.2, MSRESCAT was used to categorize a numeric susceptibility result represented in MSORRES as either "SUSCEPTIBLE", "INTERMEDIATE", or "RESISTANT". However, results from some susceptibility tests may report only a categorical result and not a numeric result. Thus, in order for susceptibility results to be represented consistently, MSRESCAT should no longer be used for this purpose. In this version, the core designation has been changed from Expected to Permissible.
datasetVariables.label: Result Category
datasetVariables.name: MSRESCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSEVLINT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSEVINTX

datasetVariables.label: Evaluation Interval Text
datasetVariables.name: MSEVINTX

description: A findings domain that represents drug susceptibility testing results only. This includes phenotypic testing (where drug is added directly to a culture of organisms) and genotypic tests that provide results in terms of susceptible or resistant. Drug susceptibility testing may occur on a wide variety of non-host organisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, protozoa and parasites.
label: Microbiology Susceptibility
name: MS
